title: Lawyers for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev file notice of appeal
title_page: Lawyers for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev file notice of appeal | Daily Mail Online
text:
Lawyers for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev filed a notice of appeal on Friday with the 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals
Lawyers for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev have filed a notice of appeal.
The notice filed on Friday with the 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals does not describe any grounds for appeal as those will be spelled out later in a separate filing.
One of the grounds is expected to be the defense argument that the trial should not have been held in Boston, where many people have connections to the marathon.
Tsarnaev's lawyers said they are appealing his conviction and sentence and the trial judge's denial of a request to publicly release the jurors' names.
They are also appealing an order that requires him to pay $101million in restitution to victims, according to Boston.com.
Judge George A O'Toole has refused to release the jurors' names and in his decision in August on the list wrote that Tsarnaev's lawyers want to examine the social media activity of the jurors and their friends.
This month the judge denied Tsarnaev's bid for a new trial after lawyers attempted to argue that his original jury was biased.

Tsarnaev pictured left with brother and fellow attacker Tamerlan, right. Tsarnaev's lawyers said they are appealing his conviction and sentence and the trial judge's denial of a request to publicly release the jurors' names
The 22-year-old was convicted last April and sentenced to death last May in the 2013 bombings, which killed three people and injured more than 260
The 22-year-old's defense team filed a motion in August calling for a new trial, saying that widespread outrage over the attacks meant he was denied a fair hearing.
The team provided a long list of public events held in honor of the victims, including a new city holiday and several races, as evidence of 'continuous and unrelenting publicity'.
His attorneys argued that a new trial should be held outside of Boston to increase Tsarnaev's chance of getting an impartial jury.
This month the judge denied Tsarnaev's bid for a new trial after lawyers attempted to argue that his original jury was biased
However, O'Toole ended up denying the motion, saying the issues his attorneys raised had been resolved prior to his trial last year.
Tsarnaev was convicted last April and sentenced to death last May in the 2013 bombings, which killed three people and injured more than 260.
He is being held at the 'Supermax' high-security prison in Florence, Colorado.
